result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn C Stark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--serve 15 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive; to commence by 9/6/22 at 6:00pm 

**Huber privileges may begin after first negative test**

--Mr. Stark is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in a 9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn C Stark

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 10:02 AM [Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
Defendant Shawn C Stark in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales in court for Shawn C Stark.  Attorney Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2

Sentencing argument/recommendations given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Stark

On Count #1, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 15  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive; to commence by 9/6/22 at 6:00pm 
--0 days credit for time already served given
**Huber privileges may begin after first negative test**
--Mr. Stark is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. 
Non-payment will result in a  9 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess: 10:25am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Ok to remove 6/16 hrg. & reschedule for P & S
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 08:46 AM Defendant Shawn C Stark in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales. DA Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $350 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 8:50 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  5/4/22 at 8:30 am  (2) Status Conference on 6/16/22 at 8:30 am
